intro: Pectis brachycephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed pectis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions such as reduced leaf size and deep root systems. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Pectis brachycephala is often found in rocky soils and is considered a component of desert scrub ecosystems.
